name: Irem Arcade Classics

name: Namco Museum Vol. 1
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Galaga: game rotated counterclockwise.)

name: Namco Museum Vol. 2
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Games are rotated counterclockwise. Cutie-Q is only present on the Japanese version. Bomb Bee is a hidden game only in the Japanese version which can be accessed by selecting Cutie-Q on the main menu and while it boots up, quickly press Circle 7 times, Square 6 times, Cross 5 times, then Start. If you complete the sequence before the grid screen, Bomb Bee will be loaded.)

name: Namco Museum Vol. 3
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Galaxian: game rotated counterclockwise.)

name: Namco Museum Vol. 4
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Assault, Assault Plus: games rotated counterclockwise. Assault Plus is a hidden game, unlocked by holding R1, R2, L1, L2, Up, and Triangle at the same time in the X-Room inside the museum.)

name: Namco Museum Vol. 5
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Dragon Spirit: game are rotated counterclockwise.)

name: Namco Museum Encore
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Games are rotated counterclockwise.)

name: Raiden DX
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode

name: Sonic Wings Special
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode

name: Strikers 1945
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Japan-only game)

name: Strikers 1945 II
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (tate mode was removed from US version but can be restored with a ROM patch or cheat device.)

name: The Raiden Project
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode (Japanese version has two tate modes, US version only has one which uses non-tate controls. a A ROM patch or a cheat device set to load code 80050BAC 0003 will correct the controls for use in tate orientation.)

name: Toaplan Shooting Battle 1
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode

name: Xevious 3D/G
details: Sony PlayStation game supports tate mode
